content.description: Sit start the sharp crack. Top out straight up through the groove.
content.location: It is on the backside from the cave.

content.description: Start on matching on nice jug hold. Move up crack, and top out.
content.location: It is to the right of Carmen Electra coming around the right side of the overhang. Jump down on a pad.

content.description: Start sitting in a little cubby with your left hand on the arete and your right hand on a sidepull. Match up the horizontal to shoot out right to the lip. You could exit left.
content.location: It is on the opposite side of the cave and is a little overhung.

content.description: Sit start matched on the big jug by the short, overhanging face. Make long moves straight up.
content.location: It is on the opposite side of the Gem Cave project. If facing barn boulder, this is behind you.

content.description: Stand start to the left of "Gem Crack". Work your way up to the other crack in the roof (see the images), and pull past it. Gain the top slab portion of the rock, and top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. There is sort of bad fall potential with the tree looming directly behind you, as you pull past that crack.
content.location: It is left of "Gem Crack". See the images.

content.description: Stand start, and climb up the ramp towards the big crack in the roof. Climb the crack up and over the roof, and finish up the crack/slab to the top.
content.location: It is in the middle of Gem Boulder. See the images.

content.description: Start with your left hand around the (left) corner on a decent side-pull/crimp and your right hand on the big (slopey) obvious start hold. You can also start both hands matched on that large (slopey) obvious start hold. Work your way over to the bulge on the face and go straight up to top-out.
content.location: It is to the left of Scarlett. See the photo.

content.description:
From sit start, climb the arete of the Gem Boulder. Start with a high slopey pinch and a low pinch. Heel hooks and sharp holds gain the topout directly above the arete.

 This climb may be easier than it felt. It's just really sharp, so it feels harder. Feel free to share your opinions, there may also be an easier way to do it.
content.protection: At least 2 pads, there is a rock in the fall zone.
content.location: It is on the road side of the Gem Boulder.

content.description: This is the tallest boulder out here. One side is overhung with a nice crack and then some mellow stuff on the other faces. The cave/overhang is smattered with smokey quartz, garnets, rose quartz, and mica, hence the name.
